Comments_List: very specific knowledge of the FBR and the many proteins/molecules that affect the process. Very translational
I learned a lot about the immune response and some of the cell types that play a role in that. We also worked on looking at how papers that have been published can still have flaws

strength: very informative and great exams
weakness: a bit redundant
Exams are fair, material was well taught, lectures were clear. The only weakness would be that it was a 9am course.

The main strength is it was taught in a very engaging way. 

The weakness is I feel like we kept covering the same material over and over. I wish we had learn more about biomaterials and less about immunology.
YES! This course is well taught and all of the exams are fair. They are open note and as long as you show up to the lectures and take notes you should do well in the class.
Yes I would. It is the best class I have taken at Yale because Themis is a great teacher.
